page.title: 01CRUDEN BAY, ABERDEENSHIRE.
page.content: Cruden Bay is a village on the East coast of Scotland, 24 miles North of Aberdeen and 9 miles south of Peterhead. It has a population of about 2000, which has increased greatly over the last ten years. One of the main features is a Golf Course. There are 5 shops, 3 hotels, a Bank, a Church, a Post Office, a Garage, a Brickworks, Police Station, a Primary School, a Joiner's business,and a Coastguard Station. There is a beautiful sandy beach, a ruined castle, a small harbour, and the Cruden Burn, which runs into the sea at the village end of the beach. .
